title: What do plants make and use cellulose for? - Quora

response.answer_text: Cellulose is a molecule that belongs to carbohydrates. About cellulose we can say that it is a: Biopolymer: macromolecules synthesized by living beings that is formed by the union of several simple units called monomers. Homopolysaccharide: molecule formed by many equal molecules. Cellulose is made up of hundreds of molecules of B-Glucose. Back to the question Cellulose is a molecule produced by plants that serves as the main component of the cell wall. The cell wall is a rigid structure that acts as a protection for the cell against the osmotic pressure it suffers. Cellulose is the most abundant component in cotton. Humans although do not have any enzyme that allows them to degrade cellulose and take advantage of glucose as a source of energy, need it because this helps the correct movement of stool in the intestine. It is one of the components of what we call dietary fiber.
